Package de.wwu.jmrigreenfootinterface

Interface JMRIInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
JMRIInterfaceImplementation
public interface JMRIInterface
The interface to access JMRI functionality. The actual realisation of communication with JMRI depends on the concrete implementation of this interface.
This class combines such functions that can be provided by JMRI via WebServer using a JSON interface and such functions that can be provided by the WiThrottle interface.
Author:
Leonard Bienbeck

  • Method Details

    • listTypes

      org.json.JSONArray listTypes()
      Returns a list of types supported by JMRI, e.g. Turnout(s) or layoutBlock(s), as JSONArray.
      Returns:
      A list of types supported by JMRI as JSONArray

    • getType

      org.json.JSONArray getType​(String type)
      Returns a list of entities of the given type as a JSONArray that are created in JMRI, e.g. the specific turnouts created.
      Parameters:
      type - The given type of the entities

    • getItem

      org.json.JSONObject getItem​(String type, String itemName)
      Returns the entity of the given type with the given name as JSONObject.
      Parameters:
      type - The given type of the entity
      itemName - The given name of the entity
      Returns:
      The entity of the given type with the given name

    • getProperty

      Object getProperty​(String type, String itemName, String propertyName)
      Returns the value of the given property of the entity of the given type with the given name as JSONObject.
      Parameters:
      type - The given type of the entity
      itemName - The given name of the entity
      propertyName - The given name of the entitiy's property
      Returns:
      the value of the given property

    • setProperty

      boolean setProperty​(String type, String itemName, String propertyName, Object value)
      Sets the value of the given attribute of the entity of the given type with the given name.
      Parameters:
      type - The given type of the entity
      itemName - The given name of the entity
      propertyName - The given name of the entitiy's property
      value - The value that the property should have
      Returns:
      true if the property has actually taken the given value at the end of the call (this is checked by a short query); false otherwise

    • getTrainOnLayoutBlock

      org.json.JSONObject getTrainOnLayoutBlock​(String layoutBlockName)
      Attempts to identify the train that is currently on the given layout block. If this fails, for example because there currently is no train on that block or for other reasons, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      layoutBlockName - The name of the layout block
      Returns:
      The data of the train currently on the layout block as JSONObject; null if no such train can be identified.

    • addLocomotive

      void addLocomotive​(String locomotiveReference, String address)
      Registers a locomotive for control via the WiThrottle protocol. A repeated, identical call of this method is harmless.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled, which is to be used in subsequent method calls (reference)
      address - The DCC address of the locomotive with a distinction for short and long addresses, e.g. "S" for short and "L" for long addresses

    • removeLocomotive

      void removeLocomotive​(String locomotiveReference)
      Deregisters a locomotive from the control through the WiThrottle protocol.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)

    • removeAllLocomotives

      void removeAllLocomotives()
      Deregisters all locomotives from the control through the WiThrottle protocol.

    • setFunctionKeyPressed

      void setFunctionKeyPressed​(String locomotiveReference, int functionKeyNumber, boolean pressed)
      Sets a function key as pressed or released
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      functionKeyNumber - The number of the function key, e.g. 1 or 12
      pressed - true if the key is to be set as pressed; false if it is to be set as released

    • setFunctionKeyLocking

      void setFunctionKeyLocking​(String locomotiveReference, int functionKeyNumber, boolean locking)
      Determines whether a certain function key is a so-called 'locking' function key, i.e. whether it should remain pressed by itself after being pressed until it is explicitly released.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      functionKeyNumber - The number of the function key, e.g. 1 or 12
      locking - true, if the function key is to remain pressed by itself after a press until it is explicitly released again; false, if it is allowed to change to the released state again by itself

    • setMovingDirection

      void setMovingDirection​(String locomotiveReference, MovingDirection movingDirection)
      Sets the direction of travel. The two possible directions of travel are provided by the MovingDirection enum.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      movingDirection - The desired direction of travel that the locomotive should follow after calling this function.

    • setSpeed

      void setSpeed​(String locomotiveReference, int speed)
      Sets the speed of the locomotive. The allowed values depend on the hardware used and the settings in JMRI.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      speed - The speed that the locomotive should have.

    • getMovingDirection

      MovingDirection getMovingDirection​(String locomotiveReference)
      Returns the current driving direction of the locomotive.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      Returns:
      The current driving direction of the locomotive

    • invertMovingDirection

      void invertMovingDirection​(String locomotiveReference)
      Reverses the current direction of travel of the locomotive.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)

    • getSpeed

      int getSpeed​(String locomotiveReference)
      Returns the current speed of the locomotive.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
      Returns:
      The current speed of the locomotive

    • doEmergencyStop

      void doEmergencyStop​(String locomotiveReference)
      Performs an emergency braking of the locomotive.
      Parameters:
      locomotiveReference - The identifier of the locomotive to be controlled (reference)
